About Atomic Energy PAEC

The Pakistan Atomic Energy Commission (PAEC) is a governmental corporation mounted in 1956 to promote peaceful packages of nuclear technology and technology in Pakistan. PAEC plays a vital function in numerous sectors, along with strength, remedy, agriculture, and enterprise.

PAEC operates nuclear energy plant life, conducts research and development in nuclear technology, and offers nuclear offerings which include radiation remedies for cancer remedy and diagnostic imaging. Additionally, PAEC is liable for ensuring nuclear safety, security, and safeguards compliance in Pakistan.

Through its research institutes, academic applications, and collaborations with global businesses, PAEC contributes to scientific advancements and human resource improvement within the subject of atomic energy. PAEC’s efforts purpose to harness nuclear energy for socio-economic development even as prioritizing safety, protection, and non-proliferation.

Overall, PAEC performs a vast position in advancing Pakistan’s abilities in nuclear technological know-how and era, contributing to national development and worldwide scientific development.
